<a href="https://signup.dollarflightclub.com/morningbrew" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Dollar Flight Club" style="width:100%;max-width: 65px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="65" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby81NjAvMTYyOTE1NDIyNi1Mb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0="></a>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>In honor of the upcoming long weekend for many readers, we present the definitive rankings of each day in the 3-day weekend:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Sunday: </strong></span><span>Nothing is better than a Sunday without the scaries.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Saturday: </strong></span><span>It’s like Friday, but without work.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong></span><span>Never going to complain about an extra day off, but it does mess with your internal clock. A classic laundry day.</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Agree? Great. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Neal Freyman, Sherry Qin, Matty Merritt </em></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INFRASTRUCTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/02/floods-fires-increase-urgency-upgrade-infrastructure-preparedness-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
US Flunks Climate Prep 101
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/02/floods-fires-increase-urgency-upgrade-infrastructure-preparedness-us?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="NEW YORK, NY - SEPTEMBER 02: Cars sit abandoned on the flooded Major Dee..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjY0L3JlbW5hbnRzX29mX2h1cnJpY2FuZV9pZGEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Spencer Platt/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A week of wild weather is putting more pressure on US lawmakers to upgrade the country’s infrastructure so that our future commutes don’t require a canoe.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hurricane Ida left 1 million Louisiana households and businesses without power earlier in the week, then on Wednesday dumped its leftovers on the Mid-Atlantic and the Northeast. At least <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/02/emergency-declared-in-new-york-city-as-ida-batters-floods-region.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">43 people were killed</a> by Ida’s remnants, which brought record rainfall and flooding to the region. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To get a sense of how much water fell on NYC Wednesday night: In one hour, the city received nearly as much rain (3.15 inches) as Chicago typically gets in the entire month of September.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Among the wild scenes: a </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/kehillahjewess/status/1433412273482211335?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">swollen river</a></span><span> in Philly, a baseball field </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/njdotcom/status/1433444747562176516?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">underwater</a></span><span>, and a </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/ohheyjenna/status/1433270546834333703?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guy smoking hookah</a></span><span> while floating down an alley.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">It’s a wake-up call</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Climate change is causing once-infrequent extreme weather events to become <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/environment/key-takeaways-un-climate-panels-report-2021-08-09/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more common</a>, according to the IPCC’s major report from last month. But the US’ current infrastructure doesn’t appear to be up to the challenge.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Massive amounts of water rushed into some NYC subway stations on Wednesday—the </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/09/02/1021185475/climate-change-means-more-subway-flooding-worldwide-like-new-york-just-experienc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third time</a></span><span> the city’s subways have flooded this summer alone. Service was suspended and was slowly resuming by yesterday afternoon. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Meanwhile, in Louisiana, the extensive power outages caused by Ida have sparked criticism of the state’s electric grid, most of which dates back to the ’50s and ’60s.  </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And we haven’t even mentioned the fires blazing out West, which are also </span><span><a href="https://newsroom.ucla.edu/releases/wildfires-california-electrical-grid-eric-fournier?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">exposing the weaknesses</a></span><span> of California’s grid.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Isn’t there an infrastructure bill in the works?</strong> Yep, a <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/09/01/infrastructure-tension-hurricane-ida-climate-change-508500?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bipartisan plan</a> passed the Senate this summer. It contains $46 billion for building resilience against disasters, and advocates say the bill is crucial to beef up the US’ climate defenses.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For evidence that government spending can meaningfully help avoid catastrophe, they point to the $14.5 billion hurricane defense system built around New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina. The new levees successfully fended off the worst of Ida on Sunday. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the House plans to vote on the infrastructure bill by September 27, though both Republicans and progressive Democrats, for very different reasons, have objections to it that could slow the process down. <em>– NF</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/02/shangchi-may-not-get-release-date-china?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
China Stonewalls Marvel
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Marvel " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjY2L3NoYW5nLWNoaS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Marvel</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marvel is introducing its first Asian superhero to its cinematic universe today. But while <em>Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings </em>is debuting in US theaters, the movie that Marvel expects to resonate most with Chinese viewers...may not be <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/02/shang-chi-doesnt-have-a-release-date-in-china-why-thats-a-big-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> in China at all. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened:</strong> All foreign movies face censorship when entering the Chinese market, and Marvel has edited previous movies to comply with the rules there. But <em>Shang-Chi</em>, which Chinese authorities have blocked from appearing in theaters thus far, is facing backlash in China over a character in the comic books called <a href="https://www.inverse.com/entertainment/shang-chi-racist-origins?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Dr. Fu Manchu</a>, Shang-Chi's father and an embodiment of popular anti-Asian stereotypes.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Fu Manchu is not in this movie, is not Shang-Chi’s father, and again, is not even a Marvel character, and hasn’t been for decades,” Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige argued. Marvel replaced the character with Iron Man’s archenemy, the Mandarin. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Feige is frustrated because lots of $$$ is being left on the table in China. China was the second-largest box office in the world before the pandemic, and Chinese moviegoers are big Marvel fans: 22% of ticket sales for 2019’s <em>Avengers: Endgame</em> came from China.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line</strong>: <em>Shang-Chi</em> isn’t the only upcoming Marvel film having trouble getting past the bouncer in China. <em>Spider-Man: No Way Home</em> and <em>Eternals</em> also don’t have Chinese release dates yet. <em>– SQ</em></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LABOR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/02/nabisco-workers-strike-cause-supply-issues?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Snacks Won't Cross Picket Lines
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/02/nabisco-workers-strike-cause-supply-issues?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Mondelez products on display" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjY3L21vbmRlbGV6X3Byb2R1Y3RfY29sbGVjdGlvbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mondelez</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to a heated labor battle, the Triscuit supply could run drier than the actual cracker. Grocery stores are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/grocers-prepare-for-possible-snack-shortages-as-mondelez-workers-strike-11630586597?mod=hp_lista_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stocking up</a> on Nabisco treats because of a production slowdown at bakeries and distribution facilities around the country.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why is production slowing down? </strong>On August 10, about 200 employees at a Nabisco bakery in Oregon put down whatever makes Ritz crackers so buttery and went on <a href="https://www.foodandwine.com/news/nabsico-worker-strike?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strike</a>. Since then, workers in four other states have joined them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What do they want?</strong> Workers want their pensions back after the company switched to a 401(k) plan in 2018. They’re also angry about a July proposal from Mondelez International, Nabisco’s parent company, that would increase shift length but cut overtime pay. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Employees have also expressed concerns about the company’s outsourcing of work to Mexico after two recent factory closures in the US.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mondelez has denied those claims and said that, while it is moving some workers to 12-hour shifts to handle the recent spike in demand, employees are well compensated.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Workers have been gaining leverage in a labor market where qualified employees are hard to find. This Nabisco standoff will test the limits of that resurgent power. <em>– MM</em></p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You deserve a vacation that <em>feels </em>like vacation this year. We’re talkin’ <strong style="color:#000">round trip in Business Class to London from $839 or Barcelona from $1,087. Economy Class to Cabo from $151, or Greece from $259 roundtrip.</strong></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before you know it, you’ll be spending <em>less</em> on your ticket to Switzerland, and a little more on schnapps, fondue, and yodeling lessons. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Sales of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the marketplace OpenSea <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-02/day-trading-army-goes-all-in-on-nfts-as-meme-stock-mania-ebbs?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit $3 billion</a> in August, up more than 10x the total of the previous month. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I would prefer to stay out of politics.”</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/02/ooo-messages-long-weekend?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Make Them Go “oooo” at Your OOO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/02/list-ooo-templates-use-youre-vacation?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Out of office message on laptop with wheels and handle like a suitcase" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjY1L29vby5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re turning this long weekend into an even <em>longer</em> weekend, let us take something off your Friday to-do list and offer a few well-crafted OOO messages. This first one is from our colleague, <a href="https://twitter.com/bsol87?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Blake Solomon</a>:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hey friend,</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I’m currently enjoying some well-earned PTO. I’ll be blissfully offline from [dates of PTO]. If something urgent comes up you can reach out to [emergency contact name/email]. But as for me, I am most likely enjoying an ice cream sundae while looking out the window (feel free to make this your own as well!). I’ll get in touch with you as soon as I’m well-rested and back online.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">[Name]</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’d like something a little...spicier, don’t worry, we’ve got even more OOO messages <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/02/list-ooo-templates-use-youre-vacation?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F09%2F02%2Fooo-messages-long-weekend" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSpencer Platt/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA week of wild weather is putting more pressure on US lawmakers to upgrade the country’s infrastructure so that our future commutes don’t require a canoe.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHurricane Ida left 1 million Louisiana households and businesses without power earlier in the week, then on Wednesday dumped its leftovers on the Mid-Atlantic and the Northeast. At least \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/02/emergency-declared-in-new-york-city-as-ida-batters-floods-region.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e43 people were killed\u003c/a\u003e by Ida’s remnants, which brought record rainfall and flooding to the region. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo get a sense of how much water fell on NYC Wednesday night: In one hour, the city received nearly as much rain (3.15 inches) as Chicago typically gets in the entire month of September.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAmong the wild scenes: a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/kehillahjewess/status/1433412273482211335?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eswollen river\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in Philly, a baseball field \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/njdotcom/status/1433444747562176516?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunderwater\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ohheyjenna/status/1433270546834333703?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eguy smoking hookah\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e while floating down an alley.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s a wake-up call\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eClimate change is causing once-infrequent extreme weather events to become \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/environment/key-takeaways-un-climate-panels-report-2021-08-09/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore common\u003c/a\u003e, according to the IPCC’s major report from last month. But the US’ current infrastructure doesn’t appear to be up to the challenge.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMassive amounts of water rushed into some NYC subway stations on Wednesday—the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/09/02/1021185475/climate-change-means-more-subway-flooding-worldwide-like-new-york-just-experienc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird time\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the city’s subways have flooded this summer alone. Service was suspended and was slowly resuming by yesterday afternoon. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMeanwhile, in Louisiana, the extensive power outages caused by Ida have sparked criticism of the state’s electric grid, most of which dates back to the ’50s and ’60s.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd we haven’t even mentioned the fires blazing out West, which are also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://newsroom.ucla.edu/releases/wildfires-california-electrical-grid-eric-fournier?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexposing the weaknesses\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of California’s grid.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIsn’t there an infrastructure bill in the works?\u003c/strong\u003e Yep, a \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/09/01/infrastructure-tension-hurricane-ida-climate-change-508500?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebipartisan plan\u003c/a\u003e passed the Senate this summer. It contains $46 billion for building resilience against disasters, and advocates say the bill is crucial to beef up the US’ climate defenses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor evidence that government spending can meaningfully help avoid catastrophe, they point to the $14.5 billion hurricane defense system built around New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina. The new levees successfully fended off the worst of Ida on Sunday. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe House plans to vote on the infrastructure bill by September 27, though both Republicans and progressive Democrats, for very different reasons, have objections to it that could slow the process down. \u003cem\u003e– NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F09%2F02%2Ffloods-fires-increase-urgency-upgrade-infrastructure-preparedness-us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjY2L3NoYW5nLWNoaS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMarvel\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMarvel is introducing its first Asian superhero to its cinematic universe today. But while \u003cem\u003eShang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings \u003c/em\u003eis debuting in US theaters, the movie that Marvel expects to resonate most with Chinese viewers...may not be \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/02/shang-chi-doesnt-have-a-release-date-in-china-why-thats-a-big-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e in China at all. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened:\u003c/strong\u003e All foreign movies face censorship when entering the Chinese market, and Marvel has edited previous movies to comply with the rules there. But \u003cem\u003eShang-Chi\u003c/em\u003e, which Chinese authorities have blocked from appearing in theaters thus far, is facing backlash in China over a character in the comic books called \u003ca href=\"https://www.inverse.com/entertainment/shang-chi-racist-origins?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDr. Fu Manchu\u003c/a\u003e, Shang-Chi's father and an embodiment of popular anti-Asian stereotypes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Fu Manchu is not in this movie, is not Shang-Chi’s father, and again, is not even a Marvel character, and hasn’t been for decades,” Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige argued. Marvel replaced the character with Iron Man’s archenemy, the Mandarin. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFeige is frustrated because lots of $$$ is being left on the table in China. China was the second-largest box office in the world before the pandemic, and Chinese moviegoers are big Marvel fans: 22% of ticket sales for 2019’s \u003cem\u003eAvengers: Endgame\u003c/em\u003e came from China.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line\u003c/strong\u003e: \u003cem\u003eShang-Chi\u003c/em\u003e isn’t the only upcoming Marvel film having trouble getting past the bouncer in China. \u003cem\u003eSpider-Man: No Way Home\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003eEternals\u003c/em\u003e also don’t have Chinese release dates yet. \u003cem\u003e– SQ\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMondelez\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThanks to a heated labor battle, the Triscuit supply could run drier than the actual cracker. Grocery stores are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/grocers-prepare-for-possible-snack-shortages-as-mondelez-workers-strike-11630586597?mod=hp_lista_pos3\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estocking up\u003c/a\u003e on Nabisco treats because of a production slowdown at bakeries and distribution facilities around the country.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy is production slowing down? \u003c/strong\u003eOn August 10, about 200 employees at a Nabisco bakery in Oregon put down whatever makes Ritz crackers so buttery and went on \u003ca href=\"https://www.foodandwine.com/news/nabsico-worker-strike?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrike\u003c/a\u003e. Since then, workers in four other states have joined them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat do they want?\u003c/strong\u003e Workers want their pensions back after the company switched to a 401(k) plan in 2018. They’re also angry about a July proposal from Mondelez International, Nabisco’s parent company, that would increase shift length but cut overtime pay. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEmployees have also expressed concerns about the company’s outsourcing of work to Mexico after two recent factory closures in the US.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMondelez has denied those claims and said that, while it is moving some workers to 12-hour shifts to handle the recent spike in demand, employees are well compensated.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWorkers have been gaining leverage in a labor market where qualified employees are hard to find. This Nabisco standoff will test the limits of that resurgent power. \u003cem\u003e– MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
